place.name: BROOME
place.gazetteerText: BROOME, or Brome, a parish in Loddon district, Norfolk; near the Waveney river and the Waveney Valley railway, 2 miles NNE of Bungay. Post Town, Bungay. Acres, 1,442. Real property, £3,011. Pop., 505. Houses, 124. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £286.* Patron, Sir W. F. F. Middleton, Bart. The church is good; and there are charities £68. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
